item.title: Add shortcuts to Windows explorer right click menu
item.description: To add a shortcut to the mouse right-click menu you have to edit the registries at Computer\HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Directory\background Alternatively you can create a .reg file and execute it. Example creating a shortcut for Atom: Windows Registry Editor Version 5.00 [HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Directory\background\shell\NameOfApp] @="Open Atom here" #path to app icon "Icon"="\"C:\\Users\\Username\\AppData\\Local\\atom\\app.ico\"" [HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT\Directory\background\shell\NameOfApp\command] #path to app executable file (%V to "open in current location") @="\"C:\\Users\\Username\\AppData\\Local\\atom\\atom.exe\" %V\"" (Don’t forget to change the variable names) Copy code to a .
